name: Umma United
overview:
Oumma Media Press Group has announced the launch of the website Umma United (www.umma-united.com), a site designed to be an Islamic alternative to Facebook. Oumma hopes that the new website will create a strong, global online community for Muslims and for people with an interest in Islamic culture. Additionally, Oumma wants the new site to serve as a forum for Muslims to interact and dialogue about what matters most to them.

The Need for a Muslim Social Network

Already, two-thirds of the world’s Internet users are members of at least one social network. Facebook and Twitter are the largest of the social networks; each have hundreds of millions of members. Of their users, 300 million of them are Muslims.

Oumma Media Press Group believes that the future of social media is in niche sites. Although the social media behemoths of the world, such as Facebook, will continue to flourish, people are increasingly turning to specialized social media sites. Some are aligning themselves with social media sites based on their geography, such as Mixi.com, while others are joining social media groups based on particular hobbies or interests.

Until Umma-United.com, there was no centralized social media space online devoted specifically to Muslims. Umma-United.com fills this gap by providing a social network that will be ethical, creative and supportive of Muslims everywhere.

Success in Beta

Umma-United.com’s beta version of the site attracted thousands of Muslim users from around the globe. Every region of the world was represented as Muslims came together to communicate online.

In 2013, Umma-United.com’s goal is to attract 2 million new users to the site. The hope is that the site will allow Muslims to transcend geography, culture, language and politics and come together in one forum to communicate based on a common spiritual foundation.

About Oumma Media Press Group

Oumma Media Press Group is the leading French-Islamic Press Group. The company edits the Islamic news website Oumma.com. For more information, visit Oumma-Media.com.
